text: well my advice for this time of year is
that metrics go out the window to some
extent I I just had a conversation with
an athlete describing the the concept
that the pace matters less than the work
matters if you missed workouts All
Summer Long by Miss I mean you weren't
able to complete the pacing you wouldn't
suddenly magically be fit as soon as the
temperature dropped
20° and so to me it's no different than
altitude we understand that the training
camp is going to be slower and if do
interval work at PACE it's going to have
to be
shorter but no one expects to come down
from altitude and be punished for having
run slower they understand that the work
is the work and your body will respond
to it when you get away from that crazy
environment and I believe the same rules
apply to heat
